column4: Hi looking for tips on installing a minimal version 10 system, i've downloaded the minimal cd and started installing with that
I want a base system with X gnome gdm and openbox
install packages with APT::Install-Recommends=false (or appropriate option in aptitude) to ensure a minimal set of dependencies
would instructions on this site still be valid? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1155961
i'm not sure, it looks like it has most of the stuff you need but you will not have as many packages without the depends
you need gnome-session, nautilus,gnome-panel and gdm to get a basic basic session
but that also will give you metacity
always the best option to install base system first
install openbox gdm and gnome-session to start, but you will have to configure it for openbox later
do you know how to use aptitude
yes, I'm just wondering if there is a metapackage I can use to acomplish this
not really 'ubuntu-desktop' is the meta for gnome ubuntu desktop gdm and gnome-session have all major dependencies to start an xsession
install openbox first, so it can be used to satisfy x-window-manager dependency
does ubuntu-desktop install games and stuff too?
you can mark a bunch of things and then see what they mark as a consequence (undo menu is your friend)
in the preferences for aptitude, set Install-Recommends to false to limit dependencies to only those which are necessary
start with ubuntu-standard it has bash-completion and a few extra niceties
